Data:
==Applies To==

* Android applications that log data.
* Android applications that handle sensitive data.

==What to Do==

Do not log sensitive data.

==Why==

If sensitive data is logged, it may be recovered by an attacker if the device is lost or compromised.

==How==

To prevent logging of sensitive data:

# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of all sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are:
#* Passwords
#* Encryption keys
#* Personal information
# **Identify logging code.** Find all code that uses the //Log// class. 
# **Review logging code.** Remove any logging code that writes sensitive data to log entries.


==Additional Resources==

* For more information about logging on Android, please see http://developer.android.com/tools/debugging/debugging-log.html
* For more information about the //Log// class, please see http://developer.android.com/reference/android/util/Log.html
* For a tutorial on Android logging, please see http://mobile.tutsplus.com/tutorials/android/logcat_android-sdk/
